sailpoint.object

Class AbstractCertificationItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.AbstractCertificationItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, WorkItemOwnerChangeListener, sailpoint.tools.WatchableMap.Watcher<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CertificationEntity, CertificationItem

    public abstract class AbstractCertificationItem
extends SailPointObject
implements java.lang.Cloneable, WorkItemOwnerChangeListener, sailpoint.tools.WatchableMap.Watcher<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>
    Abstract superclass for a certifiable item in a certification.

    In some customer situations, customers will want to add additional behavior and information to the certification model. The "custom" fields in CertificationItem can be used to store this information. Certificationer provides hooks during generation, refresh, etc... to insert custom behavior.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getTargetId

        public java.lang.String getTargetId()
        Returns the ID of the entity being certified.

        Note: The ID might reference an entity which no longer exists, such as in an archived certification. In those cases the targetName should be used to provide the user with some context.

        Returns:
        The ID of the entity being certified. Can be null.

      • setTargetId

        Set the ID of the entity being certified.

      • getTargetName

        public java.lang.String getTargetName()
        Returns the name of the entity being certified.

        Note: The entity name might have been changed since the certification was created

        Returns:
        The name of the entity being certified. Can be null. Can reference an entity which no longer exists.

      • setNextContinuousStateChange

        public void setNextContinuousStateChange(java.util.Date nextChange)

      • getNextContinuousStateChange

        public java.util.Date getNextContinuousStateChange()
        The date at which the continuous certification state will next be incremented. This is null for periodic (non-continuous) certifications, or if the state is Overdue. For CertificationEntities, this holds the nearest state change of all items.

      • setOverdueDate

        public void setOverdueDate(java.util.Date overdueDate)

      • getOverdueDate

        public java.util.Date getOverdueDate()
        The date at which this item will be (or was) overdue. This is null for periodic (non-continuous) certifications. For CertificationEntities, this is the lowest date of all items.

        A boolean indication if this item needs further action. Currently, this indicates that either a challenge needs to be addressed or a delegation decision needs to be reviewed.

      • refreshSummaryStatus

        public abstract void refreshSummaryStatus(java.lang.Boolean completeOverride)
        Refresh the summary status of this item - this sets the summary status.
        Parameters:
        completeOverride - A possibly-null boolean value to override the completion status. This allows a rule to be run to prevent completion of items.

      • refreshHasDifferences

        public abstract boolean refreshHasDifferences(IdentityDifference diff,
                                              Resolver resolver)
                                       throws GeneralException
        Refresh if this item has difference or not - this sets the hasDifferences flag. This is currently specific to identities - should generalize to support differences on other certifiable entities.
        Parameters:
        diff - The IdentityDifference object.
        resolver - The Resolver to use.
        Returns:
        If this item has differences or not.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • refreshActionRequired

      • getApplications

        public abstract java.util.List<Application> getApplications(CertificationAction action,
                                                            boolean isBulkCertified,
                                                            Resolver resolver)
                                                     throws GeneralException
        Returns a list of all applications associated with this entity's certification items.
        Parameters:
        action - The action being executed. This method only returns information for remediation requests.
        isBulkCertified - If action is bulk certified or not
        resolver - Resolver instance used to lookup Applications
        Returns:
        Non-null list of Application object.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

                                 WorkItem item,
                                 Identity newOwner,
                                 Identity prevOwner)
        Notify this item that a work item owner has been changed. This resets some state in the WorkItemMonitor if the monitor created the work item.
        Specified by:
        workItemOwnerChanged in interface WorkItemOwnerChangeListener
        Parameters:
        resolver - The Resolver to use.
        item - The WorkItem that was forwarded.
        newOwner - The new owner for the work item.
        prevOwner - The previous owner of the work item.

      • bulkCertify

        public abstract java.util.List<CertificationItem> bulkCertify(Identity who,
                                                              java.lang.String workItem,
                                                              CertificationAction bulkAction,
                                                              CertificationItemSelector selector,
                                                              boolean force)
                                                       throws GeneralException
        Bulk certify this item with the status and parameters from the given certification action. If the item is delegated and the request is not coming from a delegated work item (for example, the workItem is null), the delegation should be revoked.
        Parameters:
        who - The Identity performing the bulk certification.
        workItem - The ID of the work item in which the bulk certify is taking place.
        bulkAction - The bulk action that contains the status and parameters to use to bulk certify this identity.
        selector - The selector used to determine which items are to be bulk certified. If null, all bulk certifiable items are bulk certified.
        force - If bulk certification should be forced on the children, even if they do not usually allow it. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED FOR TESTING!
        Returns:
        A possibly empty list of CertificationItems that were not bulk certified.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • delegate

        public void delegate(Identity requester,
                     java.lang.String workItem,
                     java.lang.String recipient,
                     java.lang.String description,
                     java.lang.String comments)
              throws GeneralException
        Delegate this item to the given recipient. This also clears any action that has already be set.
        Parameters:
        requester - The Identity requesting the delegation.
        workItem - The (possibly null) ID of the work item in which the request is being made.
        recipient - The name of the recipient for the delegation.
        description - The description for the delegation.
        comments - The comments for the recipient of the delegation.
        Throws:
        GeneralException - If there is already an active delegation for this item. The caller is responsible for revoking the delegation and refreshing before calling this.

      • revokeDelegation

        public void revokeDelegation()
        Revoke the delegation for this item and roll-back any changes made while delegated.

      • rollbackChanges

        public boolean rollbackChanges(java.lang.String workItemId)
        Roll-back any changes made in the context of the given work item.
        Parameters:
        workItemId - The ID of the work item from which to roll-back changes.
        Returns:
        True if the roll-back caused any changes, false otherwise.
